timeline.bodyText: 3 is missing. Even if hardcoded it should have same output here.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
3 is the node account in the tests, so it's intentionally left out in the spec.
Also not true that it should have output as the balances query consults with the balance table. Without a balance set for an account it won't have a balance entry.
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: I agree, it won't have output if there is no balance entry for it. I meant it should have a balance to match previous behavior.
replies.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: filename should follow the pattern of <api>-<num>-<test>.spec.json where number is incrementing
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: filename should follow the pattern of <api>-<num>-<test>.spec.json where number is incrementing
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: How does this work? The only data in the database is a single cryptotransfer per setup and without Mike's branch to itemize it how is this getting broken up into finer grained transfers? edit: I see now
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need balances to be populated to get transactions? As far as I know it shouldn't join against it.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: You're  correct, we don't need it. Will remove
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we should have some data added in spec file and some hardcoded. I would prefer all be added via spec so it's clear from spec alone what state of database is and what output should be.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText:
I believe Mike's thinking here was to mimic the normal operations where a node and treasury account already exists before a new account is created.
Hence having that outside outside of the actual test logic and as part of the starting state of the database as you would see in production.
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: But treasury and nodes are just accounts themselves and shouldn't be treated differently. Also, what if we want to test a scenario where those accounts don't exist? Like your new no transactions test but for balances?
replies.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Let me know if you feel strongly. I can add comments to the spec or I can add node & treasury account creation to the spec.
replies.author: Nana-EC

replies.bodyText: Moved the config into the spec. Makes sense to have state be more clear
replies.author: Nana-EC

timeline.bodyText: This logic seems to be an improper carryover from Mike's branch to test the itemizing logic. We shouldn't be itemizing/de-itemizing anything, just taking the cryptotransfers as is.
timeline.author: steven-sheehy

replies.bodyText: Good note. Reverting to previous logic.
replies.author: Nana-EC
